headline: Air Fryer Fried Chicken
description: This air fryer fried chicken is crispy, juicy, and delicious. If you're craving a fried chicken with a little less fat, this recipe is for you.

video.description: We all love the flavor of deep or pan fried chicken, but it turns out you can replicate the taste while cutting down the calories with our healthy air fryer version. In this video, learn how to make the easy, delicious, and satisfying dish. The savory dinner also saves you time: flipping the meat only takes thirty seconds on each side. Coat the chicken with flour, seasoning, and paprika before beginning the simple technique. And cleanup couldn't be easier, making this dinner one the whole family will enjoy!
video.name: How to Make Healthy Air Fryer Fried Chicken

name: Air Fryer Fried Chicken
recipeIngredient: 1 4-pound fryer chicken, cut into 10 pieces (2 breasts cut in half, 2 wings, 2 legs, 2 thighs)

recipeInstructions.text: Marinate the chicken: Season the chicken well with salt and pepper and then add it to a bowl with buttermilk. Chicken pieces should be covered with the buttermilk. Let it sit for at least an hour or up to overnight.

Bread the chicken: To prepare the breading mixture, stir together flour, seasoned salt, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika. Remove chicken pieces from buttermilk and shake off any excess; then dip in the flour mix and coat well. Transfer breaded chicken pieces to a clean plate or wire rack to rest.

Air-fry the chicken: You will need to work in two batches if you are doing a full chicken. Spray the basket of your air fryer with nonstick spray. Place half of the pieces in the basket of your air fryer. Try to ensure the pieces don’t touch. Air needs to circulate around them. Spray the chicken pieces lightly with spray oil. Place the basket in the air fryer and turn the air fryer to 350°F. Cook for 14 minutes, then flip the fried chicken with tongs, spray lightly with oil a second time on the bottom side of the chicken, and cook for another 10 to 12 minutes, until white meat reaches 165°F and dark meat reaches 175°F (I find that cooking the dark meat a little more makes it more tender). During the air frying process, if you pull out the chicken and notice any dry flour spots on the chicken, spray those spots lightly with oil. The breading will never crisp up if it doesn’t have a tiny bit of oil to hydrate it. It will just burn.

Serve: When the fried chicken is ready, let it rest on a plate for a few minutes before serving. Serve immediately with salad, coleslaw, mashed potatoes, or your favorite fried chicken sides! Cooked fried chicken can be stored in the fridge for 5 days and reheated in a 300°F oven for 8 to 10 minutes. Did you enjoy this recipe? Let us know with a rating and review!

review.reviewBody: I loved this recipe. 1st time using our Airfryer, and I was a little under the weather (so was not really in the mood to cook), but this recipe was super easy, and I found it very tasty and moist, hubby agreed. Our son was not a fan (not as tasty as our other southern fried chicken), but I'm Ok with that considering it was not deep fried. His taste buds will acclimate, but in future may try some of the additions mentions in other's comments. .... I will definitely keep this recipe. Love it.

For 1 lb of chicken, 2 cups of flour and 2 cups of buttermilk is 30-50% too much. We added a lot more chicken to use it up. Good problem!
Had to cook at 390F to 400F for the 14min + 10min.
Adjusted spices to be
3TBSP salt
3TBSP pepper
3TBSP garlic powder
3TBSP paprika
For base flavor!

I've made wings in my air fryer and learned one thing. No flour, potato starch! Loved this recipe and convinced me that I can finally make a fried chicken at home. I'll add more spice to the costing and even Sriracha to the buttermilk but I am convinced. Thank you.
I followed the recipe and it was great, even though, I only marinated the chicken less than 1 hour.

With all the comments about the chicken wasn't enough cooked I put mine at 400F 14+10 min
I was able to reach 190F into the chicken 

I put a little bit of nature yogourt into the marinade. 
People were complaining about the lack of "kick" in the spices, I double the paprika. 

It was a success for us
